name: Poles, softwood, PCP treated
description: Pressure-treated pentachlorophenol (aka penta or PCP) softwood debarked logs seasoned utility poles. Base process data presented with allocations to within process co-products noted.  Refer to allocation worksheet for specifics.  All allocations performed using mass or volume. This sheet sets out each unit process in the production of one cubic meter of penta treated utility poles producted in the US Pacific Northwest and Southeast regions.  Important note: although most of the data in the US LCI database has  undergone some sort of review, the database as a whole has not yet  undergone a formal validation process. Please email comments to lci@nrel.gov.; Geography: US

processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: All information can be accessed by everybody.

flow.name: Poles, softwood, PCP treated
flow.category: Technosphere Flows/31-33: Manufacturing/3211: Sawmills and Wood Preservation

exchanges.description: Preservative Wood Treatment; Hazardous and Process waste disposed—Amount of hazardous waste for the survey year and units (pounds, tons, drums, etc.).  Chemical and process waste disposed—Amount of waste and units from the treatment process, such as from tanks, treatment equipment, and drip pad area, but not including hazardous waste.  This may be regulated in your state as chemical, industrial, or special waste.
